channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed Chair’s Confidence in Slowing Inflation Is ‘Not as High’ as Before
item.description: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, said the central bank was poised to leave interest rates on hold after surprisingly stubborn inflation.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.N. Says It’s Unclear How Many of Gaza’s Dead Are Women and Children
Jerome Powell says it’s ‘different this time’—and Americans and their mortgage rates are a key reason why
item.description: But the Fed chair "wouldn't call it hot," saying the wholesale inflation report was "sort of mixed."

item.title: Alice Munro, Nobel Laureate and Master of the Short Story, Dies at 92
item.description: Her stories were widely considered to be without equal, a mixture of ordinary people and extraordinary themes.

item.title: Georgia’s Parliament Gives Final Approval to ‘Foreign Agents’ Measure
item.description: The president has vowed to veto the legislation, which critics say could push the country back into Russia’s orbit. The governing party says it can override a veto.

item.title: Florida’s migrant farming community jolted by bus crash that kills 8, injures dozens more
item.description: Florida farms employ more H-2A workers than any other state, about 50,000 a year, according to the Florida Fruit & Vegetable Association.

item.title: Mike Johnson Visits Trump’s Criminal Trial to Say What He Can’t
item.description: Outside the Manhattan courthouse where Donald J. Trump is being tried on criminal charges, Mike Johnson attacked a key witness who linked the former president to a plan to cover up hush money paid to a porn star.

item.title: U.K. Summons Chinese Ambassador for Reprimand as Tensions Rise
item.description: Britain’s foreign office said it had reprimanded the Chinese ambassador, a day after three men were charged with assisting the Hong Kong intelligence service.

item.title: Rich Gen Xers are outpacing baby boomers in buying vacation homes
item.description: Interest in second homes hasn’t been this low in almost a decade, according to Redfin.

item.title: A.I.’s ‘Her’ Era Has Arrived
item.description: New chatbot technology can talk, laugh and sing like a human. What comes next is anyone’s guess.

item.title: Russia Detains Senior General, Widening Military Purge
item.description: Lt. Gen. Yuri Kuznetsov became the second senior defense official to be detained on an accusation of corruption in the past month.

item.title: ‘Judge Judy’ sues National Enquirer parent company over misattributed quote in Menendez Brothers story
item.description: “When you fabricate stories about me in order to make money for yourselves with no regard for the truth or the reputation I've spent a lifetime cultivating, it's going to cost you."

item.title: U.K. Summons Chinese Ambassador for Reprimand as Tensions Rise
item.description: Britain’s foreign office said it had reprimanded the Chinese ambassador, a day after three men were charged with assisting the Hong Kong intelligence service.

item.title: German Court Fines Far-Right Leader for Using Nazi Phrase
item.description: Björn Höcke, a state leader of the nationalist Alternative for Germany party, repeatedly used the phrase “Everything for Germany,” a slogan of the Nazi paramilitary wing, during campaign stops.

item.title: Harvard protesters voluntarily withdraw after administration agrees to discuss endowment concerns
item.description: Harvard interim President Alan Garber agreed to pursue a meeting between protesters and university officials regarding the students’ questions.
